subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit to test CORBA objects...
msgSnippet: ... It s a heck of a lot easier to use something like easymock.  Do you *really* need to test against real server objects?  I have found that is only necessary
messageBody:
On Mon, 10 Jan 2005 at 13:54:39, ricksworld2k wrote:

> Hello All,
>
> I have a client and server application that use the JDK 1.4 ORB to
> communicate between them. I am interested in the following:
>
> 1. Easily obtaining implemented CORBA server objects into my client
> for testing, and

It's a heck of a lot easier to use something like easymock. Do you *really*
need to test against real server objects? I have found that is only necessary
in a small subset of test cases.


>
> 2. Testing the CORBA server objects in the server itself (and in the
> server's JVM)

That's not really any different than a shared fixture that handles the ORB
setup/teardown.
